intro: Listrostachys monodon, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, often with a smooth surface. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
